subject: ANN: XPU2003 Workshop/Exploring Programmer Tests
msgSnippet: Call for Papers: Workshop on Exploring Programmer Tests XP/Agile Universe 2003 http://www.XProgramming.com/xpuPTsWorkshop2003/ J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar
messageBody:
Call for Papers:

Workshop on Exploring Programmer Tests
XP/Agile Universe 2003

http://www.XProgramming.com/xpuPTsWorkshop2003/

J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
Ron Jeffries, www.XProgramming.com
Rick Mugridge, University of Auckland

Enthusiasts and practitioners of test-oriented programming are invited to participate in this workshop to explore issues related to Programmer tests. Participants will share their experiences and learn through multiple group discussions on the topics that interest them most. We aim to advance the art of writing programmer tests through this process.

We will focus on Programmer Tests as defined in Test-Driven Development and the XP literature. Such tests are written by programmers to drive the development of software, demonstrate step-by-step progress towards the completion of a task and provide a safety net for refactoring.

We will explore specific strategies and techniques that participants can apply in their work, in addition to considering the "big picture" of testing.

Submissions due: 10 July 2003

For further details see: http://www.XProgramming.com/xpuPTsWorkshop2003/

Please contact jbr@... if you have any questions.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
